title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) (Amendment) Regulations 2022.
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) (Amendment) Regulations 2022.
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) (Amendment) Regulations 2022. 
(2) These Regulations come into operation on the 28th day of July 2022. 

Amendment of section 28 of Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 
2006

title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) (Amendment) Regulations 2022.
heading: 2. The Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006)
text_raw:
2. The Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) 
is amended in section 28 by inserting the following subsections after 
subsection (6): 

"(6A) Where a person who is convicted of an offence to which subsection 
(1A), (5)(b) or (6)(b) applies demonstrates that the mandatory forfeiture 
required by the subsection concerned is disproportionate, the court may in 
those exceptional circumstances adjust, modulate or mitigate the extent of the 
mandatory forfeiture order. In making this assessment the court shall have 
regard to the requirement that the severity of the sanctions must be 
commensurate with the seriousness of the breaches for which they are imposed, 
in particular by ensuring a genuinely dissuasive effect. 

(6B) Where the Court decides under subsection (6A) to substitute an order of 
forfeiture that it deems appropriate in place of a mandatory forfeiture required 
by this section as a statutory consequence of conviction, it shall give reasons 
for doing so.". 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 July, 2022. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

1 OJ L 343, 22.12.2009, p 1 
2 OJ L 286, 29.10.2008, p 1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 5th August, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [407] 3

title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) (Amendment) Regulations 2022.

text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend section 28 of the Sea Fisheries and Maritime 
Jurisdiction Act 2006.
